title: Positioning for the Next Wave
body:
Part 7: Positioning for the Next Wave

Most people miss the wave not because they can’t see it — but because they’re too attached to where they are...

Positioning isn’t reactive. It’s a decision.

title: ACID vs SALT — How Databases Mirror Generational Shifts
body:
Part 6: ACID vs SALT — How Databases Mirror Generational Shifts

You can trace the arc of technology through the way we store and move data...

In a world of infinite information, we don’t just need signal — we need structure.

title: Web2 is Crashing, Web3 and AI Are Forming — Very Differently
body:
Part 5: Web2 Is Crashing, Web3 and AI Are Forming — Very Differently

Web2 companies are slowing down. You can feel it...

But the people building it are asking the right questions. And that’s usually where the next real wave starts.

title: The A-Player Cascade
body:
Part 4: The A-Player Cascade

Steve Jobs once said: “A-players hire A-players. B-players hire C-players.” He meant it literally...

Because once you lose that edge, it’s hard to get it back.

title: The Great Migration of Talent
body:
Part 3: The Great Migration of Talent

Every wave shifts not just what gets built — but who builds it...

By the time everyone else notices, the center of gravity has moved.

title: Atlantic vs Pacific — A Tale of Mindsets
body:
Part 2: Atlantic vs Pacific — A Tale of Mindsets

You can split how people build — and how they think about building — into two mindsets...

It just means recognizing where the tide is going — and deciding how you want to swim.

title: Waves and Webs: Rethinking Innovation
body:
Part 1: Waves and Webs — Rethinking Innovation

Technology moves in waves. You can feel it before you can explain it...

You don’t need to predict the future. You just need to know where to stand.
